  1. Enter Initial Investment: Input your starting investment amount

  3. Choose Investment Period: Select how many years you plan to invest
  4. Set Expected Return: Enter your expected annual return rate
  5. View Results: See your projected portfolio growth and total returns

Investment Growth Formula

Your investment growth is calculated using compound interest:

Future Value = PV × (1 + r)^n + PMT × [((1 + r)^n - 1) / r]

Where: PV = Present value, r = Monthly return rate, n = Number of months, PMT = Monthly contribution

Frequently Asked Questions

What's a realistic expected return for investments?

Historical stock market returns average 7-10% annually, but this varies by investment type and time period. Conservative investments might return 3-5%, while aggressive growth investments might target 10-12% or higher.

How does compound interest work in investments?

Compound interest means you earn returns not only on your initial investment but also on previously earned returns. This creates exponential growth over time, making it one of the most powerful wealth-building tools.

Should I invest monthly or in lump sums?

Dollar-cost averaging (monthly investments) can reduce risk and smooth out market volatility. Lump sum investing might provide higher returns if markets rise, but monthly investing is often more practical and less risky.

How much should I invest monthly?

The amount depends on your financial goals, income, and expenses. A common rule is to invest 10-20% of your income, but start with what you can afford and increase over time. Even small amounts can grow significantly with compound interest.

What's the difference between investing and saving?

Saving typically involves low-risk accounts like savings accounts or CDs, while investing involves higher-risk assets like stocks, bonds, or mutual funds that have the potential for higher returns but also higher risk.

Investment Growth Calculator Features

  • Portfolio Projection: See how your investments grow over time
  • Contribution Impact: Understand how regular contributions accelerate growth
  • Return Analysis: Compare different return scenarios
  • Time Horizon Planning: Plan your investment timeline

Investment Growth Tips

  • Start investing as early as possible to maximize compound growth
  • Invest consistently, even small amounts add up over time
  • Diversify your investments across different asset classes
  • Consider your risk tolerance when choosing investments
  • Reinvest dividends and returns to accelerate growth
  • Review and rebalance your portfolio regularly
  • Consider tax-advantaged accounts like IRAs and 401(k)s
  • Don't try to time the market - focus on long-term growth
